Jack, known for his sailor-like brevity, responded humbly to the chief's gratitude, insisting he'd help any woman. Peterkin, wiping tears, vowed to stay until the islanders burned their idols. Soon, flames engulfed the false gods as cheers erupted. The trio pondered partings, realizing life's fleeting nature.
